Habit Stacker Pro
- Single-file Python 3 script using only standard library (tkinter, json, os, hashlib).
- GUI app for building daily habit chains with streak tracking and momentum scoring.
- Main window: title bar with **light/dark mode toggle** (auto-detects system preference via os.environ, stores in JSON).
- Central **Listbox** displays habits (name, streak days, last completed date, momentum score 0-100).
- **Entry field** + Add button to create new habits (validate non-empty, auto-generate unique ID via hashlib.sha256(name+timestamp)).
- **Keyboard-first UX**: Enter to add habit, Arrow keys/Tab to navigate Listbox, Spacebar to toggle completion on selected habit, Delete to remove.
- Select habit → **Edit button** opens dialog to rename, **Complete Today** button marks as done (updates streak/momentum, stores timestamp).
- **Momentum score**: (streak * 10) + bonus for consecutive days (decays 5pts/day missed), color-coded (green>80, yellow>50, red<50).
- **Stats panel**: bottom row shows "Current Streak: X", "Total Habits: Y", "Avg Momentum: Z%", "Days Since Start".
- Persistence: auto-save/load to 'habit_stacker.json' on every change/launch (dict of {id: {name, streak, last_date, momentum}}).
- **Share feature**: "Copy Share Link" button generates hash of all habits (json.dumps(sorted by id) → hashlib.sha256 → base64 url-safe), copies to clipboard (prints "Share hash: <hash>"), paste hash in "Load from Share" field to import.
- Window: 600x500, resizable, centered, title "Habit Stacker Pro".
- Dark mode: black bg (#1e1e1e), white text; light: white bg, black text. Toggle button switches instantly.
- Edge cases: handle empty list ("No habits yet!"), sort Listbox by momentum desc, confirm deletes, graceful JSON errors.
- Testable: add habit "Meditate", complete 3 days (streak=3, momentum=35), toggle dark mode, share/load hash.
